shortdesc.ph: Sets the channel mode of the current audio file.
Sets the channel mode of the current audio file.
Sets the channel mode of the current audio file.
Sets the channel mode of the current audio file.

section.p: In stereo audio files, the left and right channels can store different audio data. Depending on your needs, you can set the channel mode to original, left, right, or mixed.
In stereo audio files, the left and right channels can store different audio data. Depending on your needs, you can set the channel mode to original, left channel, right channel, or mixed mode.
In stereo audio files, the left and right channels can store different audio data. Depending on your needs, you can set the channel mode to original, left channel, right channel, or mixed mode.
In stereo audio files, the left and right channels can store different audio data. Depending on your needs, you can set the channel mode to original, left channel, right channel, or mixed mode.
section.note: This method applies only to stereo audio files.
This method applies to stereo audio files only.
This method applies to stereo audio files only.
This method applies to stereo audio files only.

section.title: Scenario
section.p:
In KTV scenarios, the left channel of an audio file stores the accompaniment, and the right channel stores the original vocals. You can configure as follows:
To hear only the accompaniment, set the channel mode to left.
To hear both accompaniment and vocals, set the channel mode to mixed.

section.title: Timing
section.p: You need to call this method after and after receiving the onAudioMixingStateChanged(AudioMixingStatePlaying) callback.
You must call this method after and after receiving the onAudioMixingStateChanged(AudioMixingStatePlaying) callback.
You must call this method after and after receiving the onAudioMixingStateChanged(audioMixingStatePlaying) callback.
You need to call this method after and after receiving the OnAudioMixingStateChanged(AUDIO_MIXING_STATE_PLAYING) callback.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
